name: Hosteria Del Mar

reviews.title: Poor communication
reviews.text: We tried to book a reservation twice at this hotel. We tried through their Web site and through gotopuertorico.com. We did not receive any confirmation that they got our inquiry and they didn't respond to e-mails, so we made arrangements elsewhere, but they charged us for not canceling the reservation. We eventually got our money back, but it was after a long hassle.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: I went directly to the website to book this hotel. I should have thought twice when the site traveler's review page was under constuction. The hotel room was horrible. The showere head sqirted water all over the bathroom. The bedspread and rug was dirty and dingy. The bed had bed bugs. I left with lumps all over my legs. The food was too expensive but very good. Animals are allowed at this hotel. They dogs and other neighbors dogs used the beach as their toliet. I did not once step foot on that dirty beach. Overall i would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Spend the extra cash and get a room you'll enjoy even if it's for one night.

reviews.title: Bed Bugs
reviews.text: Nice price, great location but this hotel has bed bugs.

reviews.title: Spectacular Hotel Stay
reviews.text: All in all, the location was excellent with the ocean no more than 10 yards from the hotel itself. The water was amazing allowing for swimming, and bogey boarding. The waves varied in size, and at times they were pretty big. The beach was great. Kids were building sand castles, while others were laying in the sun.

reviews.title: Not what it seems
reviews.text: The hotel itself was very nice. Of course there was sand throughout the hotel being right on the beach, but the staff did a great job keeping the building looking nice and tidy. Rooms that we stayed in were your standard hotel rooms complete with fridge. We also had a small porch overlooking the ocean and the restaurant patio.

reviews.title: Worst experience
reviews.text: Made reservations three weeks in advance at the front desk for a weekend stay. The same day we arrived we were told our room was unavailable and they had relocated us at a private residence back patio apartment. The residence was about three blocks away from the hotel and a street over the beach front. Paying for a hotel room at a beachfront hotel is not the same as paying for a “service” apartment, it was unacceptable. They should have called us as soon as they knew our reserved room was unavailable. No call, no decent accommodations, not even an offer for a rain-check. We were rudely dismissed without any concern.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and had a very enjoyable stay. The restaurant is wonderful...it makes you feel like you're on a tropical island from the tiki-style set-up of the area. The beach is literally a step outside the door and the view is also phenomenal of the ocean. The food is outstanding....a little on the expensive side, but well worth it! Our room was not an ocean front room, therefore it was a little stuffy. I would recommend an ocean front room if available. But everything is clean and in order. The receptionists are helpful, you just need to ask them. PARKING...make sure you ask the desk how to get in to park because the hotel is in a gated-in community (for safety, i presume). Once you find the gate, not hard, it is very easy to navigate yourself in the area. Literally, less than 10 minutes from the airport.
reviews.title: Very nice location, beach access, lovely restaurant!

likes.liked: — the food at the restuarant, the nice beach, good location

reviews.title: Spectacular View, a Few Concerns
reviews.text: The idea of staying at a quaint guest house right on the beach versus a big box hotel sold us to the idea of Hosteria del Mar. We fell in love with the place when we had dinner there in December. We were aware that Hosteria del Mar is rated as a two star hotel. We also read the reviews with the same issues/complaints coming up frequently. It was hard to determine if the management was addressing the problems since they do not reply on Trip Advisor. That being said, here is a synopsis of our 5 day stay there.

I arrived at the hotel in the middle of a torrential downpour, about 1:30 in the afternoon. I approached the reservation desk and I believe that a woman by the name of Nivia greeted me. She smiled and then told me that check in was not until 4:00. I explained that the taxi had dropped me, it was pouring rain, and i had all this luggage;what could I do? She smiled again and said that she didn't know what to tell me, but check in was not until 4:00. I would get very used to this smile. For the next 5 days, this smile was usually followed by a subtle insult, a snide remark, or NOTHING at all. This woman is not who i would use as the first face my customers see!! She remained totally unhelpful for our entire stay. She finally "allowed" me to put my luggage in an area of the lobby so that I could go to the bar and have a drink. She said that she would check to see when my room would be ready. NINETY minutes later she again told me that she would check on my room. Around 3:30 she gave me a key which signified the room was upstairs. I told her that we had reserved a beach front room on the first floor. She said that room was no longer available and that I had to go to the room upstairs.
reviews.title: LOVED Hosteria Del Mar & almost missed out due to poor reviews

likes.liked: — Location, food, staff, view, away from everything
likes.disliked: — A little bit of a trek to the action.

reviews.text: Another staff member helped me get my luggage to the second floor. The room was decent, but the air conditioning had not been turned on and so the temperature of the room was stifling. Plus there was a musty, chemical type smell. I turned on the air and opened the doors to remove the humidity and the other peculiar smells. I stood out on the balcony and the view was spectacular. I went back downstairs and asked why the room on the first floor was no longer available. I was told the air conditioning was broken. I was told that if the air was fixed the following day, we could trade rooms for the rest of our stay. I asked to see the room on the first floor. The room was not as spacious as the room upstairs and it opened right up onto the deck of the restaurant!! I told the receptionist that we would keep the room we had upstairs. As I was unpacking, the receptionist called and said that she had two very nice rooms downstairs that I could stay in, but then she remembered that we were staying through Tuesday so she had to check and see if the rooms were available until then. She would call me right back. Forty minutes later I walked downstairs to find out if the rooms were available. Oh yes, they were. Same smile, You mean no one called you?" I looked at both rooms. Again, they weren't as spacious and they opened right on to the restaurant. Not much privacy or view!! But they did have larger bathrooms with a tub. I again told her that we would keep the room on the second floor. But I was puzzled. When I arrived at the hotel, there were no rooms on the firat floor and now there were two??
reviews.title: Water problems are over...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hosteria Del Mar in early December of 2006. We were on a budget, and the price ($140/night) was lower than that of nearby hotels, so we booked a room for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Modest Room at Reasonable Rate; Excellent Food, Staff, Location

likes.liked: — Location; beautiful and relaxing common area; beach; tree frogs outside singing at night
likes.disliked: — the space between the ocean-side building and the street-side building

reviews.text: The hotel is located right on the beach in a quiet upscale residential neighborhood which is gated off from the rest of the city. I find that a little weird, but it did contribute to my general sense of safety in walking back from dinner in Condado, the metropolitan area. Hosteria del Mar is nowhere near Old San Juan, but you can take the A5 bus, or a cab. A few blocks from the hotel is a restaurant called Pinky's with a yoga studio upstairs, amazing smoothies and a good sense of humor. All very comfortable, safe and fun for alternative and/or gay travelers.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach inn with no water!

reviews.text: Back to the hotel. The entrance, lobby and restaurant at Hosteria Del Mar are beautiful - just take a look at their website. You can sit at a table on the beach, on the deck, or in the restaurant for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or anytime in between, and no one will hurry you along. The room was modest, but perhaps what you'd expect for that price in that area-? We have no way to know, since this was our first visit to Puerto Rico.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was on the street side, not the ocean side, because we were told that would be quieter, and it was. To get to it, we had to cross an open, roofless area between the ocean side building and the street side building, and that area, floored in cement, seemed a little grotty to me. Not dirty, but as if much less attention had been paid to how it looked than the other common areas of the hotel.
reviews.title: Stay away. Read the review of this place. Don't stay here!

reviews.text: The room itself was relatively small, very clean, painted light pink, with large cool white tiles on the floor, two windows right next to each other - about the size of a picture window - and somewhat bare walls. It had a queen-sized bed, one night table, a TV, a decent sized closet with a tall, skinny wicker bureau, and a small bathroom with a shower (no tub).
reviews.title: Welcome to the Hotel Hosteria, you can check in but you can never check out!

reviews.text: Hosteria del Mar is beautifully situated on the beach and features a surf side indoor/outdoor restaurant that gets you about as close to the water as possible.
reviews.title: Great location, but that's all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, if you're at all discriminating, beware that the apartments will disappoint you. Old, tired, dirtyish and without any views. Perhaps the regular rooms are better, I don't know. Also, beware the rollaway beds -- my son slept on the floor rather than on the old rollaway which was worn out but for which we still were charged.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: Lastly, cost is huge here. One night in our apartment plus one lunch and one dinner for five ran us $750 US. The "continental breakfast" is free, but is a joke. I had four rock hard green pear slices, dried out toast pieces and a small cake. My wife refused to eat her cake as there were clearly teeth marks in it. Ugh.
reviews.title: awful

reviews.text: Bottom line -- unless you really value a beach location be careful about this one.
reviews.title: I had a great time at the Hosteria del Mar

reviews.text: You must read the review 'awful' ? - It is absolutly correct !
reviews.title: Will not return!
